p: In this study, the preliminary phytochemical analysis of the extracts revealed the presence of carbohydrate (43.15 %; 38.30 %), proteins (23.75 %; 23.75 %), flavonoids (1.20 %; 0.80 %), alkaloids (0.60 %; 1.00 %), saponin (6.00 %; 2.40 %), tannin (1.65 %; 1.57 %), cyanide (0.24 %; 0.40 %), ash (12.40 %; 10.40 %), moisture (6.00 %;6.00 %), lipids(6.00 %;6.00 %), and fiber (8.70 %; 6.45 %) for the Tris buffer and warm aqueous extracts, respectively ( Table 1 ). The amount of extracted compounds using Tris buffer did not differ significantly ( p-value > 0.05) from that obtained from warm water.
